title: Jeffrey Epstein's business ties with banker Ariane de Rothschild revealed
subhead: The latest release of the Epstein files by the US Department of Justice has confirmed the extremely close relationship between the French-German head of the Edmond de Rothschild group and the convicted sex offender. From 2013 until his death in 2019, he acted as an unofficial adviser to the Switzerland-based bank.

title: The 'Washington Post,' legendary American daily, is shaken by mass layoffs
Emmanuel Grégoire, Socialist candidate for Paris mayor, details proposals to Le Monde
Last US-Russia nuclear treaty ends in 'grave moment' for world
subhead: 'For the first time in more than half a century, we face a world without any binding limits on the strategic nuclear arsenals of the Russian Federation and the United States of America,' UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres.

title: James Galbraith, economist: 'The Fed is an agency created by Congress, controlled by it, and accountable to it'
subhead: The US inflation decline did not result from action by the Federal Reserve and a reduction in interest rates would therefore be justified, said the University of Texas professor in an interview with Le Monde. However, in his view, Trump should've let the Republican majority in both chambers of Congress pressure the central bank.

title: 'The Mastermind,' by Kelly Reichardt: The art of losing oneself
subhead: In telling the story of an art heist gone awry, the director paints a somber and disillusioned portrait of the 1970s.

title: Robbie Williams, the nostalgic pop star
subhead: For more than 30 years, the British singer has ridden a wave of global success, releasing hit after hit and filling stadiums. At 51, still in the media spotlight that once burned him, the former boy band member remains a tireless entertainer. Now on a mega tour across Europe, he has just released his 13th album, a nod to the vibrant 1990s Britpop scene that always snubbed him.

Ukraine's 'grandfathers' go to war
subhead: The Ukrainian army has an average age of 45, significantly older than European standards. The draft has targeted men between the ages of 25 and 60, which contrasts with recruitment practices typically seen in Western countries.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'European countries have achieved unprecedented levels of prosperity and social well-being'
subhead: To win the cultural and intellectual battle, Europe must staunchly defend its model, writes the economist in his column, dismantling the narrative of a 'declining' continent.

title: Marine Le Pen's 2027 presidential bid further jeopardized by prosecution at her appeal trial
subhead: By requesting a five-year ban on election to public office on February 3, the prosecution has fueled doubts about Marine Le Pen's ability to run in the 2027 presidential election. The appeals court is due to rule on the case by the summer.

title: The end of US-Russia nuclear treaty is a dangerous signal for deterrance
